revised_title: Effects of X-ray Sterilisation on the Oestrous Cycle and Persistent Corpora Lutea
tldr: The study investigates the effects of X-ray sterilisation on the oestrous cycle and the role of persistent corpora lutea in the reproductive cycle of female mice. The research shows that X-ray sterilisation during pregnancy causes premature regression of the corpora lutea, while sterilisation during lactation leads to the permanent survival of corpora lutea. The findings suggest that neither follicles nor corpora lutea are essential for the maintenance of the oestrous cycle in unmated animals.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Reproductive Biology
